comment: His teaching philosophies differ from the general philosophies found at KSU (or in most teaching institutions for that matter!) but I found his class to be a breath of fresh air and an encouragement to me, as I look forward to using non-standard methods.

He is TERRIBLE! I mean TERRIBLE! He doesn't take attendance and he is the definition of boring. I did all the work, showed up to class, paid attention when other people would just leave and he had the audacity to give me a bad letter grade. I have never had a professor like him before and I pray to God, that I never do. Do not take this professor.

This teacher is awful. He didn't put a syllabus up online until 2 weeks before class was over (which contained rubrics for assignments that had already been turned in) All he does is read directly from the powerpoints, avoid taking him if you can!
All he does is read from a powerpoint and then lets you go.  It really is a disappointing class.

People need to get over themselves. Honestly, I think he is a wonderful teacher. He makes his students think beyond and get out of our "teacher procedure" role.  Sometimes his directions were a little unclear, but he always was willing to repeat himself or give examples. He is very approachable as well. I would take him again in a heartbeat.

Unclear is how I would describe Dr. Breault. He can take the most simple assignment and make it SO very hard to understand the directions! I have had him twice and he is all papers and participation. He is unorganized and impractical. Also, he has no confidence in himself which I found unfortunate. He is a nice person though.
This class is all papers and group work.  I honestly didn't learn anything.  He always seemed scattered and unprepared.  Grades papers very harshly!  If you can...run!
